article.headline: Detroit 76, SMS 65
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- James Thues scored a career-high 25 points Saturday to lead Detroit Mercy past Southwest Missouri State 76-65 in the season opener for both teams. Ryvon Coville added 13 points and nine rebounds to help the Titans post their 11th consecutive home-opening win. Blake Ahearn led the Bears (0-1) with 12 points. Tyler Chaney and Anthony Shavies added 10 points apiece. Chaney also pulled down eight rebounds. Detroit (1-0) trailed by eight early in the second half before embarking on a 20-4 run that gave it control of the game. Three-pointers by Thues and Ben Green, both of which came off steals, finished the spurt. The Bears turned the ball over 11 times in the second half. The teams went to the half tied at 34, but the Bears opened the second half with a 12-2 run before Detroit rallied.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
